column4: could be any number of things, something in session, too many apps in session, bad .gnome conf etc etc
hmmm i see a stupid search index load everytime i load up my ubuntu... i never use it :/
ah that would likely be the culprit. You can disable it I think..
what is that for?
it indexes your files for quick searching through tracker.
i meant if its necessary?
I'm pretty sure if you turn indexing off the tracker tool wont work so you might not be able to search for files in gnome. Not too sure.
honestly though I wouldn't turn it off..
it shouldn't be slowing down the system too much.
lOl ok mate thanx... so what can i do? :( i wanna speed up my startup screen... after i input my username and password it takes longer than usual before to load the desktop
it could be something else slowing it down. You could always try resetting gnome. Assuming your using gnome that is.
how can i reset my gnome?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=140473 <- be warned, it will trash saved prefs.
omg nooo i have themes and themes and wallpapers and compiz and beryl and omg =[
wont kill themes or wallpapers or beryl.
will trash application prefs though.
like?
panels etc
tis up to you, just a suggestion.
i need u to be sure its gonna fix the problem
can't guarantee that.
